Mini review

Camera: poor. Nearly every photo looks like an oil painting
Screen: lovely
Speakers: great but a tad boomy
Battery: on average I'm getting 6 hours after each charge which is great compared to my 3 on the Nexus 6p
Speed: no issues at all

---------- Post added at 09:46 AM ---------- Previous post was at 09:44 AM ----------

Forgot to mention that the charging speed is incredibly quick

Camera: love it, in pro mode you can do whatever you want tho, and also shoots in RAW
Screen: good colors but i hate pentile grid, and usable for vr but 1080p or FHD+ is not enough
Speakers: good stereo effect when is on orizontal, but losses fidelity at max volumes
Battery: very good, similar to my old Mi MIX (4400mah)
Speed: Fast AF  for real
Storage and Memory: not "PRO".....   
6GB ram is good but other flagships have 8GB, 
128GB storage is good too, but again, my old Mi MIX have 256GB.
Design: love it
USB-C: FULL support, you can plug whatever you want there, docs, hdmi, another phone, pendrives, mini fan, other charger, mouse, keyboard,name it.  ( my Mi MIX dont support hdmi over USB-C for example)

Honestly I absolutely love this phone. I've got a Mate 10 pro BLA-L29 international on T-mobile.

Pros:
Battery. Check my post in the battery thread, fantastic. 8.5-9+ hours SOT with light-moderate usage, 6.5+ on the conservative side for heavy usage. 

Screen is really pretty. Honestly the 18:9 OLED  1080p screen is super nice regardless of the normal mate 10 having a QHD panel. I'd say it is a very well built screen

Quick. The kirin 970 has been fast and haven't had any glitches or even odd stutters

Having oreo is great, and MIUI has been pretty swell in my experience. I've seen a lot of hate on it so I was a bit nervous, but honestly it just gives you a lot of different options in the settings I feel like. Personally as someone that likes to tinker with their device but doesnt feel like rooting, I like being able to tweak every aspect of the phone to the extent of the vast number settings.

Cons 
Really the only one I can think of currently is software stuff. I hate not being able to expand notifications from the lockscreen and idk why it doesn't let you do that. Idk if it'd an oreo thing or a MIUI thing but I hope it gets fixed in an update because I'd hope that wasn't intentional.

Will add more as I think of them 


Things I don't have enough credibility to critique :
Camera. I don't take a ton of photos apart from things like snapchat or the occasional normal photo of my pets, but in my usage the cameras have been great. I'm not going to say I'm am avid photographer though so I won't pretend I know more than I do with how good it is for someone more into professional photography

Coming from note 8. Actually usinf both as daily drivers and Huawei really have a loooong way to go
I am not talking cameras or battery but user experience, smoothness and UI. It's like comparing an iPhone with a 2015 Android phone 
Hope this device is getting better with updates

threads.text: I have M10Pro. Quality in low light is not good. It's oil drawing. Very often when I use B/W photo, picture not sharp. Bad focus. I hadn't these problems with my M9.
Well I'm getting to like it

Some pics I made with the M10pro.
https://imgur.com/a/KksWc

Loving the quality of the front and rear cameras for stills. But for video at 1080p I am finding the video capture very over sharpened. Anyone else think this. Here are some examples of camera though and think it takes really accurate nice stills. Front camera is really good after coming from a Samsung. Yes I was using beauty mode.... Level 10 😂

I might have found a workaround for those not liking the overprocessed look of the auto mode pictures: Enable wide aperture mode and put the aperture to max (16). Somehow this seems to force lower levels of sharpening. 

But I have just stumbled over that in artificial light indoors late at night (my reasoning was to find any other mode in the stock camera app that might override the standard sharpening level). More testing needs to be done. So far I like there being less artifacts and the more natural feel (although this can be subtle). 

In some conditions - especially when there are clearly defined lines like bold text in the picture, the normal mode can bring out more detail (a shelf full of books from about 2 m distance is such a case). So this might not be an improvement in all scenes. Also the wide aperture mode sometimes struggles with highly textured surfaces with no bigger objects (f.e. my woodchip wallpaper and my carpet - it outright smears the details in parts of the picture, maybe because it has no object to put in the center of the artificial aperture processing).

An other downside: In lower light with wider aperture mode you lose the automatic improvement of a scene (the one where you are prompted to hold the camera still), which really can make a huge difference.

I am interested, what you find.

Edit: So far I find the difference in bright daylight rather small. This seems to help most in lower light scenes, when the software tries too hard do pull details where are none/few.

Just got mine a couple of days ago and wanted to test the battery out.

I had 100% at 7.36am and then went out. I did some normal chrome browsing during that time. I also did the first big update. The translator one that was about 300meg. I downloaded around 500 songs to Spotify.

I got home around 4pm and this is where I really used it almost non stop until 8.34pm.

I watched some YouTube, a 45 min Netflix episode, a ton of web browsing, checking out all the phone settings, Facebook, and about 90 min of gaming (tower defence, top down 2D scrolling shooters).

I stopped at 8.34pm at 5% left. Phone has been on battery for around 13 hours.

Screen on time during the above time reported at 6 hours and 20 minutes.

I was pleased with that though doesn't hit much of the hype I've read lately.

Coming from a Nexus 6P, which my only complaint was battery life (3.5 your SOT on average) I'm happy and really my wish was to have a phone that I could use heavily all day without needing to recharge either at home or out with a power bank.

It's still early stages and I will keep monitoring.

I forgot to add this was at 1080p resolution.

The mate 10 only last 6hrs and 10%left.  So lesson is don't buy Z Play then buy another more expensive phone. now you should take more advantage of your LTE cell speed , here's mine
